Life Orb.description: Mewtwo is an astonishing offensive stallbreaker and wallbreaker with Life Orb in Ubers UU. Psystrike allows Mewtwo to bypass blanket special walls like Calm Mind Clefable and Blissey, and Shadow Ball hits Giratina, Gholdengo, and Solgaleo hard. Alternatively, Fire Blast allows it to 2HKO Solgaleo and Magearna while still hitting Gholdengo. Focus Blast hits Dark-types such as Kingambit and Arceus-Dark and is needed over Aura Sphere to hit crucial KO ranges, such as 2HKOing Arceus-Dark and OHKOing Chi-Yu. Recover helps to offset Life Orb's recoil while also increasing Mewtwo's longevity, and it gets many opportunities to use this move due to all the switches it forces. Tera Fighting is mandatory to let Mewtwo's Focus Blast OHKO Arceus-Dark and turn its Dark and Bug weaknesses into resistances, which helps against Chi-Yu and Volcarona. Mewtwo appreciates entry hazard control from allies like Giratina and Great Tusk to help its longevity. Mandibuzz, specially defensive Arceus-Dark, and Solgaleo are often solid checks to Mewtwo, meaning Pokemon like Zamazenta-C and Zacian are good partners for it. In addition, Choice Scarf Chi-Yu and Zacian can outrun and threaten Mewtwo, making Arceus-Poison an especially potent partner, as it is the only reliable check to the combination of these Pokemon.

All-out Attacker.description: Deoxys is one of Ubers UU's best wallbreakers thanks to its great mixed attacking and Speed stats and deep coverage movepool that allows it to threaten most of the tier. Superpower deals good damage to Pokemon that resist Psycho Boost such as Arceus-Dark, Dialga, and Magearna. Shadow Ball hits Giratina and Psychic-types like Mewtwo, Hatterene, opposing Deoxys, and Solgaleo. Extreme Speed allows Deoxys to pick off low health priority and Choice Scarf users or such as Palafin, Kyurem-W, and Chi-Yu. Alternatively, Knock Off allows Deoxys to secure KOs on Pokemon like Spectrier and specially defensive Solgaleo. Tera Psychic is generally preferred to boost the power of Deoxys's Psycho Boost, although Tera Ghost and Tera Fighting can be viable options, with the former boosting the power of Shadow Ball and providing a nifty immunity to Extreme Speed and the latter allowing Deoxys to beat Kingambit and Arceus-Dark. Deoxys fits best on offensive teams looking for a strong and reliable revenge killer and wallbreaker. Bulkier walls like Magearna, Giratina, and Solgaleo can take an attack from Deoxys and OHKO it or chip away at it by setting up entry hazards and letting it take Life Orb damage, so Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Arceus-Dark, and Landorus that can deal with these threats are nice. Great Tusk is a notable partner; Deoxys deals with Pokemon like Mewtwo, Kyurem-W, and Clefable that Great Tusk potentially struggles with, and in return, Great Tusk deals with Pokemon like Kingambit and Arceus-Fire. Deoxys also appreciates having a teammate that can pivot it into the game safely; thus, Magearna, Solgaleo, Landorus-T, and Palafin all make excellent partners.

Lead.description: Deoxys is one of the best leads in Ubers UU thanks to its solid offensive stats and good movepool allowing it to act as an offensive threat after setting up entry hazards. Psycho Boost is an amazing one-time nuke, dealing serious damage to most Pokemon that don't resist it. Superpower allows Deoxys to target Pokemon like Arceus-Dark, Dialga, and Kyurem-W. Generally, Deoxys prefers Stealth Rock in the final moveslot, allowing it to nearly guarantee it sets up both Stealth Rock and a layer of Spikes, although Taunt can be run instead allowing it to stop Pokemon from setting up or laying their own entry hazards. Focus Sash allows Deoxys to guarantee at least one layer of entry hazards. Tera Psychic boosts Deoxys's Psycho Boost, although Tera Ghost can be run instead, allowing it to spinblock Pokemon like Great Tusk and Cyclizar and block Extreme Speed from Arceus-Fire, which otherwise troubles it. Deoxys fits best on offense and hyper offense teams looking for a dedicated lead that can set up hazards consistently. Offensive threats like Mewtwo, Zacian, and Ogerpon-H appreciate the entry hazards Deoxys sets up to wear down their switch-ins like Arceus-Dark, Solgaleo, and Giratina. Pokemon like Spectrier and Gholdengo that can spinblock are also nice to have. If Deoxys is not running Taunt threats like Arceus-Fire, Arceus-Dark, and Mewtwo may try to use it as set-up fodder, so Pokemon like Zamazenta-C, Palafin, and Magearna that can counter these threats are helpful to have.

Calm Mind.description: Calm Mind Arceus-Dark is an incredibly potent sweeper and stallbreaker in Ubers UU. Its amazing bulk allows it to set up on the many special attackers in the tier, such as Kyurem-W, Chi-Yu, and Mewtwo, and Taunt stops Blissey and other Arceus formes from setting up alongside it with their own Calm Mind, blocks Encore from Magearna, and prevents phazing from Giratina, Skarmory, and Dialga. Recover allows it to increase its longevity and set up on some physical attackers, such as Solgaleo and Kingambit. Tera Fairy grants Arceus-Dark a resistance to Fighting-type moves from the likes of Urshifu-S, Deoxys, and Mewtwo, along with an immunity to Dragon Tail, the only phazing move that cannot be prevented by Taunt. Tera Poison turns its Fairy, Fighting, and Bug weaknesses into resistances, which is incredible for setting up on Zacian, Magearna, and Zamazenta-C. Arceus-Dark greatly benefits from the help of Pokemon that can deal with physical attackers, as Zacian and Zamazenta-C both offensively check it, so Dondozo, Lugia, Skarmory, physically defensive Solgaleo, and Magearna form good defensive cores with it. Other Pokemon that pair well with Arceus-Dark are Zamazenta-C and Annihilape, as both are Defense-boosting offensive sweepers that can wall and eliminate physical attackers for Arceus-Dark to freely take care of special attackers. Arceus-Dark is very entry hazard weak, so Pokemon like Giratina and Great Tusk that can remove hazards for Arceus-Dark are greatly appreciated. Giratina appreciates Arceus-Dark's ability to check Dark- and Ghost-types like Gholdengo and Spectrier, and Great Tusk appreciates Arceus-Dark beating common checks to it like Giratina, Skarmory, and Deoxys.

Defensive.description: Arceus-Dark has extensive options as a defensive Pokemon in Ubers UU checking metagame threats like Palafin-H and Deoxys. Foul Play hits physical attackers like Arceus-Fire and Palafin-H hard while still scoring solid damage versus Psychic-types such as Mewtwo and Lugia. Arceus-Dark can run Will-O-Wisp to cripple physical attackers, like Zacian and Zamazenta-C switching in, or it can run Stealth Rock to give its team entry hazard support if a partner doesn't have the move. Roar phazes many setup sweepers, such as Arceus and Mewtwo, whereas Taunt blocks them from setting up altogether. Taunt also shuts down many lead Pokemon like Smeargle and Galvantula and can force your opponent on the back foot provided it wins a Speed tie against opposing Arceus-Dark. Tera Poison turns Dark's Fairy, Fighting, and Bug weaknesses into resistances, which is especially helpful versus Zacian and Volcarona. Tera Fairy gives similar resistances to Poison, but the neutrality to Psychic and Ground helps against Great Tusk and Deoxys, and the valuable Dragon immunity lets Arceus-Dark beat Kyurem-W. Arceus-Dark benefits from specially defensive partners like Blissey, Calm Mind Clefable, and Giratina due to being weak to special attackers such as Magearna and Palkia-O. Arceus-Dark also pairs well with Corviknight and Regieleki, as both can remove hazards to keep it healthy and pivot it onto the field.

Support.description: Arceus-Dark's wide support movepool and good defensive typing make it an excellent support Pokemon for bulkier teams. Roar or Dragon Tail is used to stop setup sweepers such as Nasty Plot Mewtwo and Calm Mind Arceus variants. Roar can be prevented by Taunt; however, unlike Dragon Tail it can phaze Fairy-types and Pokemon behind Substitute. Taunt is an alternative option to prevent opposing Pokemon from boosting and allow Arceus-Dark to chip down passive wall Pokemon like Giratina and Solgaleo by preventing them from healing. The last moveslot is fairly flexible; Arceus-Dark can serve as an effective entry hazard setter with Stealth Rock, while Will-O-Wisp and Thunder Wave let it cripple offensive Pokemon like Palafin and Ogerpon-H. Tera Poison lets Arceus-Dark beat setup sweepers that can otherwise force it out like Zacian and Arceus-Fighting. Tera Fairy provides similar resistances as Poison while also providing an extremely useful immunity to Dragon, letting it better check threats like Palkia-O, while not causing a pesky weakness to the Psychic-type moves fired off from Pokemon such as Mewtwo and Deoxys. Arceus-Dark checks Pokemon like Chi-Yu and Kyurem-W, so it pairs well with Pokemon like Zamazenta-C, Mewtwo, Palkia-O and Solgaleo, which struggle against those threats. Physically defensive Pokemon like Great Tusk and Calm Mind Lugia complement Arceus-Dark well; the former can beat many Dark-resistant Pokemon that pressure it like both Urshifu formes while appreciating its ability to check Psychic-types, and the latter checks Fighting-types well and appreciates other setup sweepers being deterred from setting up. Giratina is another good teammate thanks to its typing letting it check sweepers that Arceus-Dark cannot, such as Arceus-Fire and Sneasler; in exchange, Arceus-Dark checks opposing Ghost- and Dark-types such as Spectrier and Chi-Yu and spreads status so Giratina can fire off powerful Hexes.

Calm Mind.description: While it faces stiff competition from other Arceus formes like Arceus-Dark and Arceus-Fire, Arceus-Electric's offensive typing and near-unresisted coverage with Ice Beam makes it a dangerous setup sweeper. Electric-type Judgment deals to Pokemon like Palkia-O, Palafin, and Toxapex. Ice Beam allows Arceus-Electric to hit Pokemon that otherwise wall it like Great Tusk, Arceus-Grass, and Dialga. Tera Flying is generally preferred as it gives Arceus-Electric a valuable immunity to Ground-type attacks from Great Tusk and Landorus, though Tera Ice can be used to boost the power of Ice Beam. Arceus-Electric generally fits best on balance teams looking for a solid setup sweeper. Arceus-Electric's most immediate issue isGround-types like Great Tusk and Landorus that can threaten it. As such, Pokemon like Palkia-O, Kyurem-W, and Palafin that can threaten them out are naturally good partners. Arceus-Electric can also struggle to break through specially defensive walls like Giratina and Solgaleo, so partners like Kingambit, Chi-Yu, and Spectrier who can remove them form potent cores with it.

Quiver Dance.description: 124 Speed is to outspeed Deoxys at +1

Choice Scarf.description: Kyurem-W is one of the most dangerous Pokemon in Ubers UU thanks to its combination of high Special Attack, good coverage options, and usable defensive profile, making it one of the tier's most dangerous revenge killers and special attackers. Draco Meteor + Ice Beam is a great STAB combination, hitting the majority of the tier. Freeze-Dry gives Kyurem-W coverage for Water-types like Palafin and Toxapex. Fusion Flare gives Kyurem-White coverage for Steel-types like Magearna, Solgaleo, and Zamazenta-C. Tera Fire allows Kyurem-W to boost Fusion Flare as well as provides it with a nifty resistance to Fairy- and Steel-type attacks from the likes of Zacian, Magearna, Dialga, and Solgaleo. Kyurem-W fits best on balance and offensive teams looking for a strong revenge killer and special attacker. Kyurem-W struggles to break through specially defensive walls like Blissey and Solgaleo, so Pokemon that can deal with these walls like Arceus-Fire, Zamazenta-C, and Landorus-T, make good partners. Entry hazard control from Pokemon like Great Tusk and Corviknight increases Kyurem-W's longevity.

Choice Specs.description: Choice Specs Kyurem-W is an unparalleled wallbreaker in Ubers UU. Draco Meteor is an nuclear bomb of an attack, easily OHKOing most neutral targets such as Dialga and Mewtwo. Ice Beam gives Kyurem-W a strong move versus Fairy-types such as Zacian and Clefable while also allowing it to hit Ground- and Flying-types, such as Great Tusk and Landorus, hard. Freeze-Dry allows Kyurem-W to OHKO Palafin and Palkia-O without dropping its Special Attack with Draco Meteor. Fusion Flare allows Kyurem-W to hit the Steel-types that would otherwise resist Ice and Dragon, such as Magearna and Solgaleo. Tera Fire is a must to power up its Fusion Flare while also helping against Zacian and Solgaleo by making its Fairy and Steel weaknesses into resistances. Kyurem-W is incredibly vulnerable to entry hazards due to its Stealth Rock weakness, meaning it appreciates hazard removal from Giratina or Great Tusk. Another great teammate that helps with hazard control is Hatterene, due to its immunity to Dragon-type moves helping against Arceus-Dragon and Garchomp, as its Magic Bounce ability provides a proactive way of preventing hazards. Kyurem-W also pairs well with slower pivots, such as Galarian Slowking and Solgaleo, as they help to get it onto the field safely. Kyurem-W is especially vulnerable to the many faster threats in the metagame, such as Zacian, Zamazenta-C, and Palkia-O, so it likes the support of Sticky Web from Galvantula and Smeargle or paralysis from Magearna and Giratina.

Specially Defensive.description: Specially defensive Solgaleo is one of the tier's premier special walls, is an amazing pivot, and is even a solid phazer. Knock Off hits Psychic- and Ghost-type Pokemon like Mewtwo, Deoxys, and Giratina, though Sunsteel Strike can be used instead as strong STAB move, to deal more damage to opposing Arceus and threaten Zacian. Knock Off's item-removing effect synergizes excellently with Roar's phazing, allowing Solgaleo to remove Heavy-Duty Boots and force foes to take repeated entry hazard damage. Roar also prevents sweepers like Zacian, Mewtwo, and Zamazenta-C from setting up on it. Tera Water removes Solgaleo's Fire and Ground weaknesses, allowing it to check Pokemon like Arceus-Fire, Trailblaze Ogerpon-H, and Great Tusk. Tera Dark, on the other hand, allows it to check Dark- and Ghost-types, like Spectrier, Giratina, and Chi-Yu. Teleport assists in getting powerful wallbreakers like Chi-Yu, Deoxys, and Kyurem-W onto the field safely. Solgaleo can have trouble with Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Kingambit, Palafin, and Landorus, so Pokemon like Kyurem-W, Great Tusk, Zamazenta-C, Palkia-O, and Arceus-Dark that can check these threats are excellent partners.

Utility.description: Magearna is one of the best defensive Pokemon in Ubers UU, thanks to its role compression as both a pivot and entry hazard stacker. Magearna provides its team with useful utility options like Spikes, Volt Switch, Encore, and Thunder Wave. Fleur Cannon is an extremely powerful move, being able to chunk most of the metagame hard, especially Fairy-weak Pokemon like Arceus-Dark, both Urshifu formes, and Kyurem-W, whereas Draining Kiss greatly improves Magearna's longevity, at the cost of increased passivity. Encore and Thunder Wave both attempt to offset Magearna's passivity, with Encore punishing Pokemon attempting to set up on it, like Zamazenta-C, Mewtwo, and Zacian, by locking them into a move. Alternatively, Thunder Wave provides speed control for its teammates and cripples offensive Pokemon, like Zacian, Palkia-O, and Mewtwo. Tera Water allows Magearna to check Pokemon like Arceus-Fire, Chi-Yu, and Great Tusk, which it wouldn’t be able to do otherwise. Tera Flying is another option, allowing it to check Pokemon like Landorus and Great Tusk while becoming immune to Spikes, though this comes at the cost of a Stealth Rock weakness. Magearna is pressured by offensive Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Landorus, and Ogerpon-H; as such, Pokemon like Giratina, Kyurem-W, and Arceus-Dark partner well with it. Magearna's unique combination of both Volt Switch and Spikes allows it to enable Pokemon like Palkia-O, Kyurem-W, and Chi-Yu fantastically, as their checks like Arceus-Dark, Solgaleo, and Palkia-O can't hold Heavy-Duty Boots.

Assault Vest.description: An Adamant nature and 52 Attack EVs allow Rillaboom to KO Palkia-O with Wood Hammer + Grassy Glide

Swords Dance.description: Zacian is one of Ubers UU's best late-game cleaners and wallbreakers thanks to Intrepid Sword, its good Attack and Speed, decent bulk for an offensive threat, and its deep coverage movepool. Close Combat targets Pokemon like Zamazenta-C and Dialga. Zacian's last moveslot is relatively flexible; Tera Blast is generally preferred with either Tera Fire or Ground to hit Pokemon like Magearna, Solgaleo, Arceus-Fire, and Skarmory, although if they are not an issue, Psychic Fangs to hit Arceus-Poison and Toxapex without having to Terstallize and Crunch to hit Deoxys and Mewtwo are viable options. Tera Fire and Ground also provide immunities to burns and Thunder Wave, respectively. If Zacian is running Crunch, Tera Dark can be used to boost said move and provide an immunity to Psychic-type attacks from the likes of Deoxys and Mewtwo. Heavy-Duty Boots allows Zacian to stay healthy and be great in the Sticky Web matchup. Zacian best fits on offensive teams looking for a solid late-game cleaner. Zacian struggles against bulkier, physically defensive Pokemon like Magearna, Skarmory, and Toxapex, so Pokemon like Chi-Yu, Deoxys, and Arceus-Dark that can handle these threats are helpful to have. Zacian has four-moveslot syndrome, so it also appreciates support from teammates like Landorus-T and Chi-Yu that can deal with the Pokemon that Zacian can't hit, like Arceus-Fire and Skarmory. Pokemon like Choice Specs Kyurem-W, Mewtwo, and Giratina like having Zacian threaten out Pokemon they struggle against like Palkia-O and Kingambit. Entry hazard support from the likes of Deoxys and Dialga helps wear down Zacian's checks, allowing it to function as a more threatening cleaner; in return, Zacian removes Pokemon they have problems with like Kingambit, Palkia-O, and Arceus-Dark for them. Pivoting from the likes of Magearna, Landorus-T, Solgaleo, and Cyclizar gives Zacian a safe opportunity to set up Swords Dance; the later can also potentially pass Zacian a free Substitute with Shed Tail.

IronPress.description: With its combination of robust defenses and good Attack, Zamazenta-C is an excellent mid- or late-game sweeper for bulkier teams. Body Press synergizes well with Iron Defense and Dauntless Shield, and when combined with Zamazenta-C's brilliant natural bulk, it can quickly clean up weakened teams. Behemoth Bash or Heavy Slam lets it Zamazenta-C answer Fairy-types, like Zacian and Tera Fairy Arceus-Dark, and Crunch lets it tackle Psychic- and Ghost-types, like Mewtwo, Giratina, Lugia, and Deoxys. 200 Speed EVs with a Jolly Nature allow it to outspeed Cyclizar, 112 Attack EVs let it have a favorable roll to 2HKO Mewtwo, and the rest of the EVs go into Defense to maximize Body Press's damage. Tera Water lets Zamazenta-C stay in on more opponents foes like Arceus-Fire, Palafin, Chi-Yu, and Kyurem-W, and Tera Flying lets you it resist Fighting-type moves from the likes of Mewtwo, Zacian, and Deoxys and be immune to Ground-type moves from Great Tusk, Landorus, and Ursaluna, though a weakness to Stealth Rock is added. Being able to check Magearna, Zacian, Dialga, Ursaluna-B, Arceus-Dark, Palafin, and Palkia-O, Zamazenta-C is appreciated by Giratina, Chi-Yu, Palkia-O, Arceus-Dark and Mewtwo. Zamazenta-C suffers from being worn down by entry hazards, so a hazard remover like Great Tusk or Giratina is needed. It also appreciates hazard support of its own from setters like Magearna and Dialga. Fighting-, Ground-, and Fire-resistant Pokemon like Arceus-Poison, Rillaboom, and Giratina are also a boon to Zamazenta-C, as they can stomach whatever hits come at it.

Calm Mind.description: 12 speed EVs allow you to outspeed base 120 Speed Pokemon at +1

Offensive Utility.description: Thanks to its good typing, stats, and ample movepool, Great Tusk can serve as both an effective entry hazard remover and wallbreaker. Knock Off helps Great Tusk punish Pokemon that wall it such as Giratina, Skarmory, and Landorus. Close Combat lets Great Tusk hit threats such as Arceus-Dark and Ursaluna hard, while Stealth Rock lets Great Tusk compress the roles of hazard setter, wallbreaker, and hazard remover. Tera Dark is used to bolster Knock Off and grant Great Tusk an immunity to Psychic-type moves from the likes of Deoxys and Mewtwo, letting it punish them with a super effective Knock Off. Tera Water can instead be used to grant Great Tusk a resistance to Palafin's Water moves and Arceus-Fire's Flare Blitz. Hazard-weak wallbreakers, such as Chi-Yu and Kyurem-W, appreciate Great Tusk removing hazards for them; in exchange, they target the physical walls that Great Tusk loathes. Kyurem-W in particular forms an excellent offensive core with it, being able to offensively pressure its checks such as Giratina and Lugia. Arceus-Dark also makes a good partner for Great Tusk, as it covers Great Tusk's weakness to special attackers while also enjoying hazards being removed. Furthermore, Arceus-Dark pressures the Ghost-types that block Great Tusk's attempts to use Rapid Spin.
